workflow.display-name: Clone virtual machine, no customization by name
workflow.description: Clones a virtual machine without changing anything except the virtual machine UUID

param.name: newvmname
param.description: Name of the new virtual machine

attrib.name: progress
attrib.description: Log progress while waiting for the task to complete

attrib.name: pollRate
attrib.description: Polling rate for the task state, in seconds

attrib.name: thinProvision
attrib.description: If TRUE, empty virtual disk space is not reserved

attrib.name: pool
attrib.description: Resource pool to which to attach this virtual machine

attrib.name: host
attrib.description: Destination host for the virtual machine. If not specified, the current host is used

attrib.name: datastore
attrib.description: Datastore in which to put the virtual machine. If not specified, the current datastore is used

attrib.name: template
attrib.description: Specifies whether or not to mark the new virtual machine as a template

attrib.name: powerOn
attrib.description: Specifies whether or not to power on the new virtual machine

attrib.name: vm
attrib.description: Virtual machine or template to clone

workflow-item.name: item0
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.basic").cloneVM(vm,vmFolder,name,powerOn,template,datastore,host,pool,thinProvision) ;

bind.name: vm
bind.description: The Source Virtual Machine or Template for the Clone Operation

bind.name: vmFolder
bind.description: The location of the new virtual machine.

bind.name: name
bind.description: The name of the new virtual machine.

bind.name: powerOn
bind.description: Specifies whether or not the new VirtualMachine should be powered on after creation.

bind.name: template
bind.description: Specifies whether or not the new virtual machine should be marked as a template.

bind.name: datastore
bind.description: The datastore where the virtual machine should be located. If not specified, the current datastore is used.

bind.name: host
bind.description: The datastore where the virtual machine should be located. If not specified, the current datastore is used.

bind.name: pool
bind.description: The resource pool to which this virtual machine should be attached.

bind.name: thinProvision
bind.description: If TRUE, empty virtual disk space is not reserved.

workflow-item.description: Creates a clone of this virtual machine. If the virtual machine is used as a template, this method corresponds to the deploy command. Any % (percent) character used in this name parameter must be escaped, unless it is used to start an escape sequence. Clients may also escape any other characters in this name parameter. The privilege required on the source virtual machine depends on the source and destination types: - source is virtual machine, destination is virtual machine - VirtualMachine.Provisioning.Clone - source is virtual machine, destination is template - VirtualMachine.Provisioning.CreateTemplateFromVM - source is template, destination is virtual machine - VirtualMachine.Provisioning.DeployTemplate - source is template, destination is template - VirtualMachine.Provisioning.CloneTemplate If customization is requested in the CloneSpec, then the VirtualMachine.Provisioning.Customize privilege must also be held on the source virtual machine.

workflow-item.name: item1
workflow-item.script: //Auto generated script, cannot be modified ! actionResult = System.getModule("com.vmware.library.vc.basic").vim3WaitTaskEnd(task,progress,pollRate) ;

bind.name: progress
bind.description: Log progess while waiting for the task

bind.name: pollRate
bind.description: Polling rate for the task state [seconds]

workflow-item.description: Wait a VIM 3 Task to end. When task ended, return the

workflow-item.name: item3
workflow-item.description: Returns a list of virtual machines from all registered vCenter Server hosts that match the provided expression.
